ul.li1: 1But Yahweh will have compassion on Jacob,
ul.li2: and he will again choose Israel
ul.li1: and set them on their land,
and the immigrant will join himself to them,
ul.li2: and they will attach themselves to the house of Jacob.
ul.li1: 2And the nations will take them
ul.li2: and bring them to their place,
ul.li1: and the house of Israel will take possession of themThat is, the nations in the land of Yahweh
ul.li2: as slaves and female slaves.

ul.li1: they will take their captors captive
ul.li2: and rule over their oppressors.

chapter.pericope: The Downfall of the King of Babylon
chapter.p: 3And it shall happen on the day Yahweh gives you rest from your pain and turmoil and hard labor which you had to perform,Literally “was worked by you”

ul.li1: 4that you will take this taunt against the king of Babylon,
ul.li2: and you will say:
ul.li1: “How the oppressor has ceased!
ul.li2: his insolenceThe meaning of the word is uncertain; others translate it as “fury,” “hostility,” or even “golden city” has ceased.
ul.li1: 5Yahweh has broken the staff of the wicked,
ul.li2: the scepter of rulers,
ul.li1: 6that struck the peoples in wrath, a blow without ceasing,
ul.li2: that ruled the nations in anger
with unrestrained persecution.Literally “persecution without withholding”
ul.li1: 7All of the earth rests and is quiet;
ul.li2: they break forth into singing.
ul.li1: 8Even the cypresses rejoice over you,
ul.li2: the cedars of Lebanon:
ul.li1: ‘Since you were laid down,
ul.li2: no wood cutter comes up against us.’
ul.li1: 9Sheol below is getting excited over you,
ul.li2: to meet you when you come;Literally “your entrance”
ul.li1: it arouses the dead spirits for you,
ul.li2: all of the leaders of the earth.
It raises all of the kings of the nations from their thrones.
ul.li1: 10All of them will respond and say to you,
‘You yourself also were made weak like us!
ul.li2: You have become the same as us!’
ul.li1: 11Your pride is brought down to Sheol,
ul.li2: and the sound of your harps;
ul.li1: maggotsHebrew “maggot” are spread out beneath you like a bed,
ul.li2: and your covering is worms.Hebrew “worm”
ul.li1: 12How you have fallen from heaven, morning star, son of dawn!
ul.li2: You are cut down to the ground, conqueror of nations!

chapter.p: 13And you yourself said in your heart,

ul.li1: ‘I will ascend to heaven;
ul.li2: I will raise up my throne above the stars of God;
ul.li1: and I will sit on the mountain of assembly
ul.li2: on the summit of Zaphon;Or “of the north”
ul.li1: 14I will ascend to the high places of the clouds,Hebrew “cloud”
ul.li2: I will make myself like the Most High.’
ul.li1: 15But you are brought down to Sheol,
ul.li2: to the depths of the pit.
ul.li1: 16Those who see you will stare at you,
ul.li2: they will look closely at you:
ul.li1: ‘Is this the man who made the earth tremble,
ul.li2: who caused kingdoms to shake,
ul.li1: 17who made the world like the desert
ul.li2: and destroyed its cities,
who would not let his prisoners go home?’
ul.li1: 18All the kings of the nations, all of them, lie in glory,
ul.li2: each one in his house.
ul.li1: 19But as for you, you are thrown away from your grave,
ul.li2: like an abhorrent shoot,
ul.li1: clothed with the slain,
ul.li2: those pierced by the sword,
ul.li1: those who go down to the stones of the pit,
ul.li2: like a corpse that is trodden down.
ul.li1: 20You will not be united with them in burial
because you have destroyed your land,
ul.li2: you have killed your people.

chapter.p: The descendantsHebrew “descendant” of evildoers will not be mentioned for eternity!

ul.li1: 21Prepare a place of slaughter for his sons
ul.li2: because of the sin of their ancestors.Or “fathers”
ul.li1: Let them not rise and take possession of the earth
ul.li2: or fill up the face of the world with cities.”
ul.li1: 22“And I will rise up against them,”
“and I will cut off name and a remnant from Babylon,
ul.li2: and offspring and posterity,”

ul.li1: 23“And I will make her a possession of the hedgehog,
ul.li2: and pools of water,
and I will sweep her away with the broom of destruction,”

ul.li1: “SurelyThe oath formula begins literally “If not” just as I have intended, so it shall be.
ul.li2: And just as I have planned, it shall stand:
ul.li1: 25to break Assyria in my land,
ul.li2: and I will trample him down on my mountains;
ul.li1: and he shall remove his yoke from them,
ul.li2: and he shall remove his burden from hisThat is, their shoulders.”Hebrew “shoulder”
ul.li1: 26This is the plan that is planned concerning all of the earth;
ul.li2: and this is the hand that is stretched out over all of the nations.
ul.li1: 27For Yahweh of hosts has planned, and who will frustrate it?
ul.li2: And his hand is stretched out, and who will turn it back?

chapter.p: 28In the year of the death of king Ahaz there was this oracle:

ul.li1: 29You must not rejoice, all you Philistines,
ul.li2: that the rod that struck you is broken,
ul.li1: for a viper will come forth from the root of the snake,
ul.li2: and its fruit will be a flying serpent.
ul.li1: 30And the firstborn of the poor will graze,
ul.li2: and the needy will lie down in security;
ul.li1: but I will cause your root to die in famine,
ul.li2: and it will kill your remnant.
ul.li1: 31Wail, gate! Cry, city!
ul.li2: Melt,With fear or despair Philistia, all of you!
ul.li1: For smoke is coming from the north,
ul.li2: and there is no straggler in his ranks.

chapter.p: 32And what will one answer the messengers of the nation?

ul.li1: That Yahweh has founded Zion,
ul.li2: and the needy of his people will take refuge in it.
